拖延时间(暂缓决定或说明)；见风使舵，顺应时势

temporize

英文：

[verb]:to act to suit the time or occasion : yield to current or dominant opinion

[verb]:to draw out discussions or negotiations so as to gain time

 

注释：

 

倾向于…，易于…

[verb]:to employ a press in basketball

[verb]:to impress men as soldiers or sailors

[noun]:a : a crowd or crowded condition : THRONG b : a thronging or crowding forward or together

[noun]:a : an apparatus or machine by which a substance is cut or shaped, an impression of a body is taken, a material is compressed, pressure is applied to a body, liquid is expressed, or a cutting tool is fed into the work by pressure b : a building containing presses or a business using presses

[noun]:CLOSET, CUPBOARD

[noun]:the properly smoothed and creased condition of a freshly pressed garment

[noun]:a : PRINTING PRESS b : the act or the process of printing c : a printing or publishing establishment

[noun]:a : the gathering and publishing or broadcasting of news : JOURNALISM b : newspapers, periodicals, and often radio and television news broadcasting c : news reporters, publishers, and broadcasters d : comment or notice in newspapers and periodicals

[noun]:any of various pressure devices (as one for keeping sporting gear from warping when not in use)

[noun]:a lift in weight lifting in which the weight is raised to shoulder height and then smoothly extended overhead without assist from the legs---compare CLEAN AND JERK, SNATCH

[noun]:impressment into service especially in a navy

英文：

[verb]:to erect and fix firmly in place

[noun]:a : the relative level, intensity, or extent of some quality or state b (1) : the property of a sound and especially a musical tone that is determined by the frequency of the waves producing it : highness or lowness of sound (2) : a standard frequency for tuning instruments c (1) : the difference in the relative vibration frequency of the human voice that contributes to the total meaning of speech (2) : a definite relative pitch that is a significant phenomenon in speech

[verb]: to change or alter in form, appearance, or nature and especially to a higher form

[verb]: to subject (as an element) to transmutation

[verb]: to undergo transmutation

注释：

 

违背(法律或道德的限度)

transgress

英文：

[verb]:to violate a command or law : SIN

[verb]:to go beyond a boundary or limit

[verb]:to go beyond limits set or prescribed by : VIOLATE

[verb]:to pass beyond or go over (a limit or boundary)

encroach

英文：

[verb]:to enter by gradual steps or by stealth into the possessions or rights of another

[verb]:to advance beyond the usual or proper limits

overstep

英文：

[verb]:EXCEED, TRANSGRESS

trespass

英文：

[verb]:a : ERR, SIN b : to make an unwarranted or uninvited incursion

[verb]:to commit a trespass especially : to enter unlawfully upon the land of another

[verb]:VIOLATE

[noun]:a : a violation of moral or social ethics : TRANSGRESSION especially : SIN b : an unwarranted infringement

[noun]:a : an unlawful act committed on the person, property, or rights of another especially : a wrongful entry on real property b : the legal action for injuries resulting from trespass

infringe

英文：

[verb]:to encroach upon in a way that violates law or the rights of another

[verb]:ENCROACH ― used with on or upon

注释：

 

传送，传播

transmit

英文：

[verb]:a : to send or convey from one person or place to another : FORWARD b : to cause or allow to spread: as (1) : to convey by or as if by inheritance or heredity : HAND DOWN (2) : to convey (infection) abroad or to another

[verb]:a (1) : to cause (as light or force) to pass or be conveyed through space or a medium (2) : to admit the passage of : CONDUCT b : to send out (a signal) either by radio waves or over a wire

[verb]:to send out a signal either by radio waves or over a wire

transfer

英文：

[verb]:a : to convey from one person, place, or situation to another : MOVE, SHIFT b : to cause to pass from one to another : TRANSMIT c : TRANSFORM, CHANGE

[verb]:to make over the possession or control of : CONVEY

[verb]:to print or otherwise copy from one surface to another by contact

[verb]:to move to a different place, region, or situation especially : to withdraw from one educational institution to enroll at another

[verb]:to change from one vehicle or transportation line to another

[noun]:a : conveyance of right, title, or interest in real or personal property from one person to another b : removal or acquisition of property by mere delivery with intent to transfer title

[noun]:one that transfers or is transferred especially : a graphic image transferred by contact from one surface to another

[noun]:a place where a transfer is made (as of trains to ferries or as where one form of power is changed to another)

[noun]:a ticket entitling a passenger on a public conveyance to continue the trip on another route

注释：

 

互换位置，调换

transpose

英文：

[verb]: to change in form or nature : TRANSFORM

[verb]: to render into another language, style, or manner of expression : TRANSLATE

[verb]: to transfer from one place or period to another : SHIFT

[verb]:to change the relative place or normal order of : alter the sequence of

[verb]:to write or perform (a musical composition) in a different key

[verb]:to bring (a term) from one side of an algebraic equation to the other with change of sign

[noun]:a matrix formed from another matrix by interchanging the rows and columns

interchange 

英文：

[verb]:to put each of (two things) in the place of the other

[verb]:EXCHANGE

[verb]:to change places mutually

[noun]:the act, process, or an instance of interchanging : EXCHANGE

[noun]:a junction of two or more highways by a system of separate levels that permit traffic to pass from one to another without the crossing of traffic streams

permute

英文：

[verb]: to change the order or arrangement of especially : to arrange in all possible ways

注释：

 

横穿过，横跨

traverse

英文：

[verb]:a : to go against or act in opposition to : OPPOSE, THWART b : to deny (as an allegation of fact or an indictment) formally at law

[verb]:a : to go or travel across or over b : to move or pass along or through

[verb]:to make a study of : EXAMINE

[verb]:to lie or extend across : CROSS

[verb]: a : to move to and fro over or along b : to ascend, descend, or cross (a slope or gap) at an angle c : to move (a gun) to right or left on a pivot

[verb]:to make or carry out a survey of by using traverses

[verb]:to move back and forth or from side to side

[verb]:to move or turn laterally : SWIVEL

[verb]:a : to climb at an angle or in a zigzag course b : to ski across rather than straight down a hill

[verb]:to make a survey by using traverses

[noun]:something that crosses or lies across

[noun]:OBSTACLE, ADVERSITY

[noun]:a formal denial of a matter of fact alleged by the opposing party in a legal pleading

[noun]:a : a compartment or recess formed by a partition, curtain, or screen b : a gallery or loft providing access from one side to another in a large building

[noun]:a route or way across or over: as a : a zigzag course of a sailing ship with contrary winds b : a curving or zigzag way up a steep grade c : the course followed in traversing

[noun]:the act or an instance of traversing : CROSSING

[noun]:a protective projecting wall or bank of earth in a trench

[noun]:a : a lateral movement (as of the saddle of a lathe carriage) also : a device for imparting such movement b : the lateral movement of a gun about a pivot or on a carriage to change direction of fire

[noun]:a line surveyed across a plot of ground

[adjective]:lying across : TRANSVERSE

注释：

 

滑稽的模仿

[noun]:a burlesque translation or literary or artistic imitation usually grotesquely incongruous in style, treatment, or subject matter

[noun]:a debased, distorted, or grossly inferior imitation

踏，践踏；行走

tread

英文：

[verb]:a : to step or walk on or over b : to walk or proceed along : FOLLOW

[verb]:a : to beat or press with the feet : TRAMPLE b : to subdue or repress as if by trampling : CRUSH

[verb]:to copulate with ― used of a male bird

[verb]:a : to form by treading : BEAT b : to execute by stepping or dancing

[verb]:to move or proceed on or as if on foot

[verb]:a : to set foot b : to put one's foot : STEP

[verb]:COPULATE

[noun]:a mark (as a footprint or the imprint of a tire) made by or as if by treading

[noun]:a (1) : the action of treading (2) : an act or instance of treading : STEP b : manner of stepping c : the sound of treading

[noun]:a : the part of a shoe or boot sole that touches the ground also : the pattern on the bottom of a sole b (1) : the part of a wheel or tire that makes contact with a road or rail (2) : the pattern of ridges or grooves made or cut in the face of a tire

[noun]:the distance between the points of contact with the ground of the two front wheels or the two rear wheels of a vehicle

[noun]:a : the upper horizontal part of a step b : the width of such a tread

step

英文：

[verb]:a : to move by raising the foot and bringing it down elsewhere or by moving each foot in succession b : DANCE

[verb]:a : to go on foot : WALK b obsolete : ADVANCE, PROCEED c : to be on one's way : LEAVE ― often used with along d : to move briskly

[verb]:to press down with the foot

[verb]:to come as if at a single step

[verb]:to take by moving the feet in succession

[verb]:a : to move (the foot) in any direction : SET b : to traverse on foot

[verb]:to go through the steps of : PERFORM

[verb]:to make erect by fixing the lower end in a step

[verb]:to measure by steps

[verb]:a : to provide with steps b : to make steps in

[verb]:to construct or arrange in or as if in steps

[noun]:a rest for the foot in ascending or descending: as a : one of a series of structures consisting of a riser and a tread b : a ladder rung

[noun]:a (1) : an advance or movement made by raising the foot and bringing it down elsewhere (2) : a combination of foot or foot and body movements constituting a unit or a repeated pattern (3) : manner of walking : STRIDE b : FOOTPRINT  c : the sound of a footstep

[noun]:a : the space passed over in one step b : a short distance c : the height of one stair

[noun]:plural : COURSE, WAY

[noun]:a : a degree, grade, or rank in a scale b : a stage in a process

[noun]:a frame on a ship designed to receive an upright shaft especially : a block supporting the heel of a mast

[noun]:an action, proceeding, or measure often occurring as one in a series

[noun]:a steplike offset or part usually occurring in a series

[noun]:an interval in a musical scale

[noun]:STEP AEROBICS

[noun]:a slight lead in or as if in a race

 pace

英文：

[verb]:a : to walk with often slow or measured tread b : to move along : PROCEED

[verb]:to go at a pace ― used especially of a horse

[verb]:a : to measure by pacing ― often used with off b : to cover at a walk

[verb]:to cover (a course) by pacing ― used of a horse

[verb]:a : to set or regulate the pace of also : to establish a moderate or steady pace for (oneself) b (1) : to go before : PRECEDE (2) : to set an example for : LEAD c : to keep pace with

[noun]:a : rate of movement especially : an established rate of locomotion b : rate of progress specifically : parallel rate of growth or development c : an example to be emulated specifically : first place in a competition d (1) : rate of performance or delivery : TEMPO especially : SPEED (2) : rhythmic animation : FLUENCY

[noun]:a manner of walking : TREAD

[noun]:a : STEP b : any of various units of distance based on the length of a human step

[noun]:a plural : an exhibition or test of skills or capacities b : GAIT especially : a fast 2-beat gait (as of the horse) in which the legs move in lateral pairs and support the animal alternately on the right and left legs

[preposition]:contrary to the opinion of ― usually used as an expression of deference to someone's contrary opinion ― usually italic

注释：

 

 

 

 

 

 

艰苦跋涉

trek

[verb]:to take more steps while holding a basketball than the rules allow

趋势，倾向

trend

英文：

[verb]:a : to extend in a general direction : follow a general course b : to veer in a new direction : BEND

[verb]: a : to show a tendency : INCLINE b : to become deflected : SHIFT

[noun]:a line of general direction or movement

[noun]:a : a prevailing tendency or inclination : DRIFT b : a general movement : SWING c : a current style or preference : VOGUE d : a line of development : APPROACH

[noun]:the general movement over time of a statistically detectable change also : a statistical curve reflecting such a change

drift 

英文：

[verb]:a : to become driven or carried along (as by a current of water, wind, or air) b : to move or float smoothly and effortlessly

[verb]:a : to move along a line of least resistance b : to move in a random or casual way c : to become carried along subject to no guidance or control

[verb]:a : to accumulate in a mass or become piled up in heaps by wind or water b : to become covered with a drift

[verb]:to vary or deviate from a set course or adjustment

[verb]:a : to cause to be driven in a current b West : to drive (livestock) slowly especially to allow grazing

[verb]:a : to pile in heaps b : to cover with drifts

[noun]:a : the act of driving something along b : the flow or the velocity of the current of a river or ocean stream

[noun]:something driven, propelled, or urged along or drawn together in a clump by or as if by a natural agency: as a : wind-driven snow, rain, cloud, dust, or smoke usually at or near the ground surface b (1) : a mass of matter (as sand) deposited together by or as if by wind or water (2) : a helter-skelter accumulation c : DROVE, FLOCK d : something (as driftwood) washed ashore e : rock debris deposited by natural agents specifically : a deposit of clay, sand, gravel, and boulders transported by a glacier or by running water from a glacier

[noun]:a : a general underlying design or tendency b : the underlying meaning, import, or purport of what is spoken or written

[noun]:something (as a tool) driven down upon or forced into a body

[noun]:the motion or action of drifting especially spatially and usually under external influence: as a : the lateral motion of an aircraft due to air currents b : an easy moderate more or less steady flow or sweep along a spatial course c : a gradual shift in attitude, opinion, or position d : an aimless course especially : a foregoing of any attempt at direction or control e : a deviation from a true reproduction, representation, or reading especially : a gradual change in the zero reading of an instrument or in any quantitative characteristic that is supposed to remain constant

[noun]:a : a nearly horizontal mine passageway driven on or parallel to the course of a vein or rock stratum b : a small crosscut in a mine connecting two larger tunnels

[noun]:a : an assumed trend toward a general change in the structure of a language over a period of time b : GENETIC DRIFT

[noun]:a mass of planted flowers

注释：

 

成小股流动

trickle

英文：

[verb]:a : to issue or fall in drops b : to flow in a thin gentle stream

[verb]:a : to move or go one by one or little by little b : to dissipate slowly

[noun]:a thin, slow, or intermittent stream or movement

drop

英文：

[verb]:to fall in drops

[verb]:a (1) : to fall unexpectedly or suddenly (2) : to descend from one line or level to another b : to fall in a state of collapse or death c of a card : to become played by reason of the obligation to follow suit d of a ball : to fall or roll into a hole or basket

[verb]:to enter or pass as if without conscious effort of will into some state, condition, or activity

[verb]:a : to cease to be of concern : LAPSE b : to pass from view or notice : DISAPPEAR ― often used with out c : to become less ― often used with off

[verb]:to move with a favoring wind or current ― usually used with down

[verb]:to let fall : cause to fall

[verb]:a : GIVE UP 2, ABANDON b : DISCONTINUE c : to break off an association or connection with : DISMISS

[verb]:a : to utter or mention in a casual way b : WRITE

[verb]:a : to lower or cause to descend from one level or position to another b : to cause to lessen or decrease : REDUCE

[verb]:of an animal : to give birth to

[verb]:a : LOSE b : SPEND c : to get rid of

[verb]:a : to bring down with a shot or a blow b : to cause (a high card) to fall c : to toss or roll into a hole or basket

[verb]:a : to deposit or deliver during a usually brief stop ― usually used with off  b : AIR-DROP

[verb]:to cause (the voice) to be less loud

[verb]:a : to leave (a letter representing a speech sound) unsounded b : to leave out in writing : OMIT

[verb]:to draw from an external point

[verb]:to take (a drug) orally : SWALLOW

[noun]:a (1) : the quantity of fluid that falls in one spherical mass (2) plural : a dose of medicine measured by drops b : a minute quantity or degree of something nonmaterial or intangible c : a small quantity of drink d : the smallest practical unit of liquid measure

[noun]:something that resembles a liquid drop: as a : a pendent ornament attached to a piece of jewelry also : an earring with such a pendant b : a small globular cookie or candy

[noun]:[2drop] a : the act or an instance of dropping : FALL b : a decline in quantity or quality c : a descent by parachute also : the people or equipment dropped by parachute d : a place or central depository to which something (as mail, money, or stolen property) is brought for distribution or transmission also : the act of depositing something at such a place

[noun]:a : the distance from a higher to a lower level or through which something drops b : a decrease in electric potential

[noun]:a slot into which something is to be dropped

[noun]:[2drop] : something that drops, hangs, or falls: as a : a movable plate that covers the keyhole of a lock b : an unframed piece of cloth stage scenery also : DROP CURTAIN c : a hinged platform on a gallows d : a fallen fruit

[noun]:the advantage of having an opponent covered with a firearm broadly : ADVANTAGE, SUPERIORITY ― usually used in the phrase get the drop on

[noun]:a move back from the line of scrimmage (as in preparation for making a forward pass)

leak

英文：

[verb]:a : to enter or escape through an opening usually by a fault or mistake b : to let a substance or light in or out through an opening

[verb]:a : to become known despite efforts at concealment b : to be the source of an information leak

[verb]:to permit to enter or escape through or as if through a leak

[verb]:to give out (information) surreptitiously

[noun]:a : a crack or hole that usually by mistake admits or lets escape b : something that permits the admission or escape of something else usually with prejudicial effect

[noun]:the act, process, or an instance of leaking

[noun]:sometimes vulgar : an act of urinating ― used especially in the phrase take a leak      

dribble

英文：

[verb]:to issue sporadically and in small bits

[verb]:to fall or flow in drops or in a thin intermittent stream : TRICKLE

[verb]:to let saliva trickle from the corner of the mouth : DROOL

[verb]:to come or issue in piecemeal or desultory fashion

[noun]:a tiny or insignificant bit or quantity

[noun]:a small trickling stream or flow

[noun]:an act, instance, or manner of dribbling a ball or puck

fire

[verb]:a : to become irritated or angry ― often used with up b : to become filled with excitement or enthusiasm

[verb]:a : to discharge a firearm b : to emit or let fly an object

[verb]:to tend a fire

[verb]:to transmit a nerve impulse

[noun]:a (1) : the phenomenon of combustion manifested in light, flame, and heat (2) : one of the four elements of the alchemists b (1) : burning passion : ARDOR (2) : liveliness of imagination : INSPIRATION

[noun]:a : fuel in a state of combustion (as on a hearth) b British : a small gas or electric space heater

[noun]:a : a destructive burning (as of a building) b (1) : death or torture by fire (2) : severe trial or ordeal

[noun]:BRILLIANCY, LUMINOSITY

[verb]:a archaic : to slide down the ways b : to make a start

[noun]:a large boat that operates from a ship

[noun]:a small motorboat that is open or that has the forepart of the hull covered

注释：

 

修剪

trim

英文：

[verb]:to embellish with or as if with ribbons, lace, or ornaments

[verb]:a : to administer a beating to : THRASH b : DEFEAT

[verb]:a : to make trim and neat especially by cutting or clipping b : to free of excess or extraneous matter by or as if by cutting c : to remove by or as if by cutting

[verb]:a (1) : to cause (as a ship) to assume a desirable position in the water by arrangement of ballast, cargo, or passengers (2) : to adjust (as an airplane or submarine) for horizontal movement or for motion upward or downward b : to adjust (as cargo or a sail) to a desired position

[verb]:to adjust (as one's opinions) for reasons of expediency ― often used in the phrase trim one's sails

[verb]:a : to maintain neutrality between opposing parties or to favor each equally b : to change one's views for reasons of expediency

[verb]:to assume or cause a boat to assume a desired position in the water

[noun]:suitable or excellent condition

[noun]:a : one's clothing or appearance b : material used for ornament or trimming c : the woodwork in the finish of a building especially around openings d : the interior furnishings of an automobile

[noun]:a : the position of a ship or boat especially with reference to the horizontal also : the difference between the draft of a ship forward and that aft b : the relation between the plane of a sail and the direction of the ship c : the buoyancy status of a submarine d : the attitude of a lighter-than-air craft relative to a fore-and-aft horizontal plane e : the attitude with respect to wind axes at which an airplane will continue in level flight with free controls

[noun]:something that is trimmed off or cut out

[noun]:a haircut that neatens a previous haircut

[adjective]:obsolete : EXCELLENT, FINE

[adjective]:ready for service or use also : in good physical condition

[adjective]:exhibiting neatness, good order, or compactness of line or structure

[adverb]:in a trim manner : TRIMLY ― used chiefly in combination

pare

英文：

[verb]:to trim off an outside, excess, or irregular part of

[verb]:to diminish or reduce by or as if by paring

shave

英文：

[verb]:a : to remove a thin layer from b : to cut off in thin layers or shreds : SLICE c : to cut off closely

[verb]:a : to sever the hair from (the head or another part of the body) close to the roots b : to cut off (hair or beard) close to the skin

beat

英文：

[verb]: to strike repeatedly: a : to hit repeatedly so as to inflict pain ― often used with up b : to walk on : TREAD c : to strike directly against forcefully and repeatedly : dash against d : to flap or thrash at vigorously e : to strike at in order to rouse game also : to range over in or as if in quest of game f : to mix by stirring : WHIP ― often used with up g : to strike repeatedly in order to produce music or a signal

[verb]:to cause to strike or flap repeatedly

[verb]:a : OVERCOME, DEFEAT also : SURPASS ― often used with out b : to prevail despite c : BEWILDER, BAFFLE d (1) : FATIGUE, EXHAUST (2) : to leave dispirited, irresolute, or hopeless e : CHEAT, SWINDLE

[verb]:a (1) : to act ahead of usually so as to forestall (2) : to report a news item in advance of b : to come or arrive before c : CIRCUMVENT d : to outmaneuver (a defender) and get free e : to score against (a goalkeeper)

[verb]:a (1) : PULSATE, THROB (2) : TICK b : to sound upon being struck

[noun]:a : a regularly traversed round b : a group of news sources that a reporter covers regularly

英文：

[noun]:an act of overturning : OVERTURN

[noun]:a : a minor physical disorder b : an emotional disturbance

[noun]:a : a part of a rod (as the head on a bolt) that is upset b : the expansion of a bullet on striking

[adjective]:emotionally disturbed or agitated

shake

英文：

[verb]:to move irregularly to and fro

[verb]:to vibrate especially as the result of a blow or shock

[verb]:to tremble as a result of physical or emotional disturbance

[verb]:to experience a state of instability : TOTTER

[verb]:to briskly move something to and fro or up and down especially in order to mix

[verb]:to clasp hands

[verb]:TRILL

[verb]:to brandish, wave, or flourish often in a threatening manner

[verb]:to cause to move to and fro, up and down, or from side to side especially in a repetitive, rhythmic, or quick jerky manner

[verb]:to cause to quake, quiver, or tremble

[verb]:a : to free oneself from b : to get away from : get rid of

[verb]:to lessen the stability of : WEAKEN

[verb]:to bring to a specified condition by or as if by repeated quick jerky movements

[verb]:to dislodge or eject by quick jerky movements of the support or container

[verb]:to clasp (hands) in greeting or farewell or as a sign of goodwill or agreement

[verb]:to stir the feelings of : UPSET, AGITATE

[noun]:an act of shaking: as a : an act of shaking hands b : an act of shaking oneself

[noun]:a : a blow or shock that upsets the equilibrium or disturbs the balance of something b : EARTHQUAKE

[noun]:plural a : a condition of trembling or nervousness specifically : DELIRIUM TREMENS b : MALARIA

[noun]:something produced by shaking: as a : a fissure separating annual rings of growth in timber b (1) : MILK SHAKE (2) : a beverage resembling a milk shake but made without milk

[noun]:a wavering, quivering, or alternating motion caused by a blow or shock

[noun]:TRILL

[noun]: a very brief period of time

[noun]:plural : one that is exceptional especially in importance, ability, or merit ― usually used in the phrase no great shakes

[noun]:a shingle split from a piece of log usually three or four feet (about one meter) long

[noun]:DEAL

英文：

[verb]:to collect into shocks

[verb]:to drive by or as if by a shock

[verb]:to meet with a shock : COLLIDE

[verb]:to cause surprise or shock

[noun]:a pile of sheaves of grain or stalks of Indian corn set up in a field with the butt ends down

[noun]:the impact or encounter of individuals or groups in combat

[noun]:a : a violent shake or jar : CONCUSSION b : an effect of such violence

[noun]:a (1) : a disturbance in the equilibrium or permanence of something (2) : a sudden or violent mental or emotional disturbance b : something that causes such disturbance c : a state of being so disturbed

[noun]:a state of profound depression of the vital processes associated with reduced blood volume and pressure and caused usually by severe especially crushing injuries, hemorrhage, or burns

[noun]:sudden stimulation of the nerves and convulsive contraction of the muscles caused by the discharge of electricity through the animal body

[noun]:a : STROKE 5 b : CORONARY THROMBOSIS

[noun]:SHOCK ABSORBER

[noun]:a thick bushy mass (as of hair)

[adjective]:BUSHY, SHAGGY

英文：

[verb]:a : to support by material or moral assistance---often used with up b : SUBSTANTIATE c : to assume financial responsibility for d : to provide musical accompaniment for---often used with up

[verb]:of the wind : to shift counterclockwise ― compare VEER

[verb]:to have the back in the direction of something

[noun]: a (1) : the rear part of the human body especially from the neck to the end of the spine (2) : the body considered as the wearer of clothes (3) : capacity for labor, effort, or endurance (4) : the back considered as the seat of one's awareness of duty or failings (5) : the back considered as an area of vulnerability b : the part of a lower animal (as a quadruped) corresponding to the human back c : SPINAL COLUMN d : SPINE

[noun]:a : the side or surface opposite the front or face : the rear part also : the farther or reverse side b : something at or on the back for support c : a place away from the front

[noun]:a position in some games (as football or soccer) behind the front line of players also : a player in this position

[adjective]:a : being at or in the back b : distant from a central or main area c : articulated at or toward the back of the oral passage

[verb]:to become different

[verb]:of the voice : to shift to lower register : BREAK

[noun]:a fresh set of clothes

[noun]:an order in which a set of bells is struck in change ringing

shift

英文：

[verb]:to exchange for or replace by another : CHANGE

[verb]:a : to change the place, position, or direction of : MOVE b : to make a change in (place)

[verb]:to change phonetically

[verb]:a : to change place or position b : to change direction c : to change gears d : to depress the shift key (as on a typewriter)

[verb]:a : to assume responsibility b : to resort to expedients

[verb]:a : to go through a change b : to change one's clothes c : to become changed phonetically

[noun]:a : a means or device for effecting an end b (1) : a deceitful or underhand scheme : DODGE (2) : an effort or expedient exerted or tried in difficult circumstances : EXTREMITY

[noun]:a : a change in direction b : a change in emphasis, judgment, or attitude

[noun]:a : a group of people who work or occupy themselves in turn with other groups b (1) : a change of one group of people (as workers) for another in regular alternation (2) : a scheduled period of work or duty

[noun]:a change in place or position: as a : a change in the position of the hand on a fingerboard (as of a violin) b (1) : FAULT (2) : the relative displacement of rock masses on opposite sides of a fault or fault zone c (1) : a simultaneous change of position in football by two or more players from one side of the line to the other (2) : a change of positions made by one or more players in baseball to provide better defense against a particular hitter d : a change in frequency resulting in a change in position of a spectral line or band---compare DOPPLER EFFECT e : a movement of bits in a computer register a specified number of places to the right or left

[noun]:a removal from one person or thing to another : TRANSFER

[noun]:CONSONANT SHIFT

[noun]:a bid in bridge in a suit other than the suit one's partner has bid---compare JUMP

[noun]:a hollowed-out place: as a : a cave, pit, or well in the ground b : BURROW c : an unusually deep place in a body of water (as a river)

[noun]:a : a shallow cylindrical hole in the putting green of a golf course into which the ball is played b : a part of the golf course from tee to putting green also : the play on such a hole as a unit of scoring

justify

英文：

[verb]:a : to prove or show to be just, right, or reasonable b (1) : to show to have had a sufficient legal reason (2) : to qualify (oneself) as a surety by taking oath to the ownership of sufficient property

2 a archaic : to administer justice to b archaic : ABSOLVE c : to judge, regard, or treat as righteous and worthy of salvation

[verb]:a : to space (as lines of text) so that the lines come out even at the margin b : to make even by justifying

[verb]:a : to show a sufficient lawful reason for an act done b : to qualify as bail or surety

[verb]:to justify lines of text

[verb]:to accomplish, provide, or produce readily or easily

[verb]:THROW

[verb]:VOMIT---often used in the phrase toss one's cookies

[verb]:a : to move restlessly or turbulently especially : to twist and turn repeatedly b : to move with a quick or spirited gesture

[verb]:to decide an issue by flipping a coin

[noun]:the state or fact of being tossed

[noun]:an act or instance of tossing: as a : an abrupt tilting or upward fling b : a deciding by chance and especially by flipping a coin c : THROW, PITCH

 

swing

英文：

[verb]:a : to cause to move vigorously through a wide arc or circle b : to cause to sway to and fro c (1) : to cause to turn on an axis (2) : to cause to face or move in another direction

[verb]:to suspend so as to permit swaying or turning

[verb]:to convey by suspension

[verb]:a (1) : to influence decisively (2) : to bring around by influence b : to handle successfully : MANAGE

[verb]:to play or sing (as a melody) in the style of swing music

[verb]:to move freely to and fro especially in suspension from an overhead support

[verb]:a : to die by hanging b : to hang freely from a support

[verb]:to move in or describe a circle or arc: a : to turn on a hinge or pivot b : to turn in place c : to convey oneself by grasping a fixed support

[verb]:a : to have a steady pulsing rhythm b : to play or sing with a lively compelling rhythm specifically : to play swing music

[verb]:to shift or fluctuate from one condition, form, position, or object of attention or favor to another

[verb]:a : to move along rhythmically b : to start up in a smooth vigorous manner

[verb]:to hit or aim at something with a sweeping arm movement

[verb]:a : to be lively, exciting, and up-to-date b : to engage freely in sex

[noun]:an act or instance of swinging : swinging movement: as a (1) : a stroke or blow delivered with a sweeping arm movement <a batter with a powerful swing> (2) : a sweeping or rhythmic movement of the body or a bodily part (3) : a dance figure in which two dancers revolve with joined arms or hands (4) : jazz dancing in moderate tempo with a lilting syncopation b (1) : the regular movement of a freely suspended object (as a pendulum) along an arc and back (2) : back and forth sweep <the swing of the tides> c (1) : steady pulsing rhythm (as in poetry or music) (2) : a steady vigorous movement characterizing an activity or creative work d (1) : a trend toward a high or low point in a fluctuating cycle (as of business activity) (2) : an often periodic shift from one condition, form, position, or object of attention or favor to another

[noun]:a : liberty of action b (1) : the driving power of something swung or hurled (2) : steady vigorous advance : driving speed          

[noun]:the progression of an activity, process, or phase of existence

[noun]:the arc or range through which something swings   

[noun]:something that swings freely from or on a support especially : a seat suspended by a rope or chains for swinging to and fro on for pleasure

[noun]:a : a curving course or outline b : a course from and back to a point : a circular tour

[noun]:jazz that is played (as by a big band) with a steady beat and that uses the harmonic structures of popular songs and the blues as a basis for improvisations and arrangements

[noun]:a short pass in football thrown to a back running to the outside

 

pitch

英文：

[verb]:to erect and fix firmly in place

[verb]:to throw usually with a particular objective or toward a particular point : as a : to throw (a baseball) to a batter b : to toss (as coins) so as to fall at or near a mark <pitch pennies> c : to put aside or discard by or as if by throwing

[verb]:a : to present or advertise especially in a high-pressure way : PLUG, PROMOTE b : to attempt to persuade especially with a sales pitch c : to present (a movie or program idea) for consideration (as by a TV producer)

[verb]:a (1) : to cause to be at a particular level or of a particular quality (2) : to set in a particular musical key b : to cause to be set at a particular angle : SLOPE

[verb]:to utter glibly and insincerely

[verb]:a : to use as a starting pitcher b : to play as pitcher

[verb]:to hit (a golf ball) in a high arc with backspin so that it rolls very little after striking the green

[verb]:THROW

[verb]:a : to fall precipitately or headlong b (1) of a ship : to have the bow alternately plunge precipitately and rise abruptly (2) of an aircraft, missile, or spacecraft : to turn about a lateral axis so that the forward end rises or falls in relation to the after end c : BUCK

[verb]:to hit upon or happen upon something

[verb]:to incline downward : SLOPE

[verb]:to make a sales pitch

[noun]:a : SLOPE also : degree of slope : RAKE b : the distance between any of various things: as (1) : distance between one point on a gear tooth and the corresponding point on the next tooth (2) : distance from any point on the thread of a screw to the corresponding point on an adjacent thread measured parallel to the axis c : the theoretical distance a propeller would advance longitudinally in one revolution d : the number of teeth or of threads per inch e : a unit of width of type based on the number of times a letter can be set in a linear inch

[noun]:the action or a manner of pitching especially : an up-and-down movement---compare YAW

[noun]:a : the relative level, intensity, or extent of some quality or state b (1) : the property of a sound and especially a musical tone that is determined by the frequency of the waves producing it : highness or lowness of sound (2) : a standard frequency for tuning instruments c (1) : the difference in the relative vibration frequency of the human voice that contributes to the total meaning of speech (2) : a definite relative pitch that is a significant phenomenon in speech

[noun]:a : a steep place : DECLIVITY b : the portion of a route (as in mountain climbing or caving) between belay points

[noun]:an all-fours game in which the first card led is a trump

[noun]:a : an often high-pressure sales presentation b : ADVERTISEMENT c : RECOMMENDATION, PLUG

[noun]:a : the delivery of a baseball by a pitcher to a batter b : a baseball so thrown c : PITCHOUT

flounder

[verb]:to proceed or act clumsily or ineffectually

[noun]:FLATFISH especially : a marine fish of either of two families (Pleuronectidae and Bothidae) that include important food fishes

lurch

英文：

transitive verb

[verb]:to move with a lurch also : STAGGER

[noun]:a decisive defeat in which an opponent wins a game by more than double the defeated player's score especially in cribbage

[noun]:a sudden roll of a ship to one side

[noun]:an abrupt jerking, swaying, or tipping movement  also : STAGGER

tumble

[verb]:to issue forth hurriedly and confusedly

[verb]:to come by chance : STUMBLE

[verb]:to come to understand : CATCH ON

[noun]:a : a disordered mass of objects or material b : a disorderly state

[noun]:a reeling motion

roll

英文：

[verb]:a : to impel forward by causing to turn over and over on a surface b : to cause to revolve by turning over and over on or as if on an axis c : to cause to move in a circular manner d : to form into a mass by turning over and over e : to impel forward with an easy continuous motion f : to cause to move in a given direction by or as if by turning a crank

[verb]:to press, spread, or level with a roller : make smooth, even, or compact---often used with out

[verb]:a : to move on rollers or wheels b : to cause to begin operating or moving

[verb]:a : to sound with a full reverberating tone b : to make a continuous beating sound upon : sound a roll upon c : to utter with a trill d : to play (a chord) in arpeggio style

[verb]:to combine so as to comprise one entity--- usually used in the phrase rolled into one

[verb]:to rob (a drunk, sleeping, or unconscious person) usually by going through the pockets broadly : ROB

[verb]:BOWL

[verb]:a : to move along a surface by rotation without sliding b (1) : to turn over and over (2) : to luxuriate in an abundant supply : WALLOW

[verb]:a : to move onward or around as if by completing a revolution : ELAPSE, PASS b : to shift the gaze continually c : to revolve on an axis

[verb]:to move about : ROAM, WANDER

[verb]:a : to go forward in an easy, gentle, or undulating manner b : to flow in a continuous stream : POUR c : to flow as part of a stream of words or sounds d : to have an undulating contour e : to lie extended : STRETCH

[verb]:a : to travel in a vehicle b : to become carried on a stream c : to move on wheels

[verb]:a : to make a deep reverberating sound b : TRILL

[verb]:a : to swing from side to side b : to walk with a swinging gait : SWAY

[verb]:a : to take the form of a cylinder or ball b : to respond to rolling in a specified way

[verb]:a : to get under way : begin to move or operate b : to move forward : develop and maintain impetus especially : to proceed or progress with notable ease or success

[verb]:to execute a somersault

[verb]:of a football quarterback : to run toward one flank usually parallel to the line of scrimmage especially before throwing a pass---often used with out

[noun]:a (1) : a written document that may be rolled up : SCROLL specifically : a document containing an official or formal record (2) : a manuscript book b : a list of names or related items : CATALOG c : an official list : as (1) : MUSTER ROLL (2) : a list of members of a school or class or of members of a legislative body

[noun]:a list of names or related items : CATALOG c : an official list : as (1) : MUSTER ROLL (2) : a list of members of a school or class or of members of a legislative body

[noun]:something that is rolled up into a cylinder or ball or rounded as if rolled : as a : a quantity (as of fabric or paper) rolled up to form a single package b : a hairdo in which some or all of the hair is rolled or curled up or under c : any of various food preparations rolled up for cooking or serving especially : a small piece of baked yeast dough d : a cylindrical twist of tobacco e : a roll of paper on which music for a player piano is recorded in perforations which actuate the keys f : a flexible case (as of leather) in which aritcles may be rolled and fastened by straps or clasps g (1) : paper money folded or rolled into a wad (2) slang : BANKROLL

[noun]:something that performs a rolling action or movement : ROLLER

[noun]:a wheel for making decorative lines on book covers also : a design impressed by such a tool

[noun]:a : a sound produced by rapid strokes on a drum b : a sonorous and often rhythmical flow of speech c : a heavy reverberatory sound

[noun]:a rolling movement or an action or process involving such movement : as a : a swaying movement of the body b : a side-to-side movement (as of a ship or train) c (1) : a flight maneuver in which a complete revolution about the longitudinal axis of an airplane is made with the horizontal direction of flight being approximately maintained (2) : the motion of an aircraft or spacecraft about its longitudinal axis d : a somersault executed in contact with the ground---on a roll : in the midst of a series of successes : on a hot streak---sometimes used with a modifier

[verb]:to hoist in place

[noun]:an inclination or deflection caused by or as if by swaying

[noun]:a : a controlling influence b : sovereign power : DOMINION c : the ability to exercise influence or authority : DOMINANCE

注释：

 

 

减少，变小，衰微

wane

英文：

[noun]:a : the act or process of waning b : a period or time of waning specifically : the period from the full moon to the new moon

decline

[verb]:to withhold consent

[verb]:to become less in amount

[verb]:to give in prescribed order the grammatical forms of (a noun, pronoun, or adjective)

[verb]:to cause to bend or bow downward

[verb]:a : to refuse to undertake, undergo, engage in, or comply with b : to refuse especially courteously

[noun]:the process of declining: a : a gradual physical or mental sinking and wasting away b : a change to a lower state or level

[noun]:the period during which something is deteriorating or approaching its end

[noun]:a downward slope

[noun]:a : an act of twisting : the state of being twisted b : a dance performed with strenuous gyrations especially of the hips c : the spin given the ball in any of various games d : a spiral turn or curve e (1) : torque or torsional stress applied to a body (as a rod or shaft) (2) : torsional strain (3) : the angle through which a thing is twisted

[noun]:a : a turning off a straight course b : ECCENTRICITY, IDIOSYNCRASY c : a distortion of meaning or sense

[noun]:a : a turning off a straight course b : ECCENTRICITY, IDIOSYNCRASY c : a distortion of meaning or sense

[noun]:a : an unexpected turn or development b : a clever device : TRICK c : a variant approach or method : GIMMICK

[noun]:a front or back dive in which the diver twists sideways a half or full turn before entering the water

给…打蜡

wax

英文：

[verb]:a : to treat or rub with wax usually for polishing, stiffening, or reducing friction b : to apply wax to (as legs) as a depilatory

[verb]:to record on phonograph records

[verb]:a : to increase in size, numbers, strength, prosperity, or intensity b : to grow in volume or duration c : to grow toward full development

[verb]:to increase in phase or intensity ― used chiefly of the moon, other satellites, and inferior planets

[verb]:to assume a (specified) characteristic, quality, or state : BECOME

[noun]:a substance that is secreted by bees and is used by them for constructing the honeycomb, that is a dull yellow solid plastic when warm, and that is composed of a mixture of esters, cerotic acid, and hydrocarbons ― called also beeswax

[noun]: any of various substances resembling the wax of bees: as a : any of numerous substances of plant or animal origin that differ from fats in being less greasy, harder, and more brittle and in containing principally compounds of high molecular weight (as fatty acids, alcohols, and saturated hydrocarbons) b : a solid substance (as ozokerite or paraffin wax) of mineral origin consisting usually of hydrocarbons of high molecular weight c : a pliable or liquid composition used especially in uniting surfaces, excluding air, making patterns or impressions, or producing a polished surface

[noun]:something likened to wax as soft, impressionable, or readily molded

[noun]:a waxy secretion especially : EARWAX

[noun]:a phonograph recording

[noun]:INCREASE, GROWTH---usually used in the phrase on the wax

[noun]:a fit of temper : RAGE

[noun]:LUSTER, GLOSS

[noun]:a glassy film

[verb]:to become smooth or glossy by or as if by friction

[noun]:a : a smooth glossy surface : LUSTER b : freedom from rudeness or coarseness : CULTURE c : a state of high development or refinement

[noun]:the action or process of polishing

[noun]:a preparation that is used to produce a gloss and often a color for the protection and decoration of a surface

shine

英文：

[verb]:to emit rays of light

[verb]:to be bright by reflection of light

[verb]:to have a bright glowing appearance

[verb]:to be conspicuously evident or clear

[verb]:a : to cause to emit light b : to throw or direct the light of

[verb]:past &past part shined : to make bright by polishing

[noun]:brightness caused by the emission of light

[noun]:brightness caused by the reflection of light : LUSTER

[noun]:BRILLIANCE, SPLENDOR

[noun]:fair weather : SUNSHINE

[noun]:TRICK, CAPER---usually used in plural

[noun]:LIKING, FANCY

[noun]:a : a polish or gloss given to shoes b : a single polishing of a pair of shoes

注释：

 

渐满，逐渐增大

wax 

英文：

[verb]:a : to treat or rub with wax usually for polishing, stiffening, or reducing friction b : to apply wax to (as legs) as a depilatory

[verb]:to record on phonograph records

[verb]:a : to increase in size, numbers, strength, prosperity, or intensity b : to grow in volume or duration c : to grow toward full development

[verb]:to increase in phase or intensity ― used chiefly of the moon, other satellites, and inferior planets

[verb]:to assume a (specified) characteristic, quality, or state : BECOME

[noun]:a substance that is secreted by bees and is used by them for constructing the honeycomb, that is a dull yellow solid plastic when warm, and that is composed of a mixture of esters, cerotic acid, and hydrocarbons ― called also beeswax

[noun]: any of various substances resembling the wax of bees: as a : any of numerous substances of plant or animal origin that differ from fats in being less greasy, harder, and more brittle and in containing principally compounds of high molecular weight (as fatty acids, alcohols, and saturated hydrocarbons) b : a solid substance (as ozokerite or paraffin wax) of mineral origin consisting usually of hydrocarbons of high molecular weight c : a pliable or liquid composition used especially in uniting surfaces, excluding air, making patterns or impressions, or producing a polished surface

[noun]:something likened to wax as soft, impressionable, or readily molded

[noun]:a waxy secretion especially : EARWAX

[noun]:a phonograph recording

[noun]:INCREASE, GROWTH---usually used in the phrase on the wax

[noun]:a fit of temper : RAGE

develop

英文：

[verb]:a : to set forth or make clear by degrees or in detail : EXPOUND b : to make visible or manifest c : to treat (as in dyeing) with an agent to cause the appearance of color d : to subject (exposed photograph material) especially to chemicals in order to produce a visible image also : to make visible by such a method e : to elaborate (a musical idea) by the working out of rhythmic and harmonic changes in the theme

[verb]: a : to work out the possibilities of b : to create or produce especially by deliberate effort over time

[verb]:a : to make active or promote the growth of b (1) : to make available or usable (2) : to make suitable for commercial or residential purposes c : to move (as a chess piece) from the original position to one providing more opportunity for effective use

[noun]:a : a low indistinct but often continuous sound b : a soft or gentle utterance

[noun]:an atypical sound of the heart typically indicating a functional or structural abnormality

whistle

英文：

[verb]:a : to send, bring, signal, or call by or as if by whistling b : to charge (as a basketball or hockey player) with an infraction

[verb]:to produce, utter, or express by whistling

[noun]:a : a small wind instrument in which sound is produced by the forcible passage of breath through a slit in a short tube b : a device through which air or steam is forced into a cavity or against a thin edge to produce a loud sound

[noun]:a : a shrill clear sound produced by forcing breath out or air in through the puckered lips b : the sound produced by a whistle c : a signal given by or as if by whistling

[noun]:a sound that resembles a whistle especially : a shrill clear note of or as if of a bird

[verb]:to require or suggest strongly a remedy or disposition

[noun]:an instance of crying: as a : an inarticulate utterance of distress, rage, or pain b obsolete : OUTCRY, CLAMOR

[noun]:a obsolete : PROCLAMATION b plural Scottish : BANNS

[noun]:ENTREATY, APPEAL

[noun]:a loud shout

[noun]:WATCHWORD, SLOGAN

[noun]:a : common report b : a general opinion

[noun]:the public voice raised in protest or approval

[noun]:a fit of weeping

[noun]:the characteristic sound or call of an animal

[noun]:a : a pack of hounds b (1) : PURSUIT---used in the phrase in full cry (2) : a peak of activity or excitement---used in the phrase in full cry

howl

英文：

[verb]:to emit a loud sustained doleful sound characteristic of members of the dog family

[verb]:to cry out loudly and without restraint under strong impulse (as pain, grief, or amusement)

[verb]:to go on a spree or rampage

[verb]:to utter with unrestrained outcry

[verb]:to drown out or cause to fail by adverse outcry---used especially with down

wail

英文：

[verb]:to express sorrow audibly : LAMENT

[verb]:to make a sound suggestive of a mournful cry

[verb]:to express dissatisfaction plaintively : COMPLAIN

[verb]:BEWAIL

[verb]:to say or express plaintively

[noun]:the act or practice of wailing : loud lamentation

[noun]:a : a usually prolonged cry or sound expressing grief or pain b : a sound suggestive of wailing c : a querulous expression of grievance : COMPLAINT

shriek

英文：

[verb]:to utter a sharp shrill sound

[verb]:a : to cry out in a high-pitched voice : SCREECH b : to suggest such a cry (as by vividness of expression)

[verb]:to utter with a shriek

[verb]:to express in a manner suggestive of a shriek

[noun]:a shrill usually wild or involuntary cry

[noun]:a sound resembling a shriek

 scream

英文：

[verb]:a (1) : to voice a sudden sharp loud cry (2) : to produce harsh high tones b : to make a noise resembling a scream c : to move with great rapidity

[verb]:a : to speak or write with intense or hysterical emotion b : to protest, demand, or complain vehemently c : to laugh hysterically

[verb]:to produce a vivid startling effect

[verb]:to utter with or as if with a scream

[noun]:a loud sharp penetrating cry or noise

[noun]:a very funny person or thing

注释：

 

弯弯曲曲地行进

zigzag

英文：

[verb]:to form into a zigzag or move along a zigzag course

[verb]:to lie in, proceed along, or consist of a zigzag course

[noun]:one of a series of short sharp turns, angles, or alterations in a course also : something having the form or character of such a series

[adjective]:having short sharp turns or angles

[adverb]:in or by a zigzag path or course

注释：n./a.之字形(的)

 

 

分成区

zone

英文：

[verb]:to surround with a zone : ENCIRCLE

[verb]:to arrange in or mark off into zones specifically : to partition (a city, borough, or township) by ordinance into sections reserved for different purposes (as residence or business)

[noun]:a : any of five great divisions of the earth's surface with respect to latitude and temperature ― compare FRIGID ZONE, TEMPERATE ZONE, TORRID ZONE b : a portion of the surface of a sphere included between two parallel planes

[noun]: a : an encircling anatomical structure b (1) : a subdivision of a biogeographic region that supports a similar fauna and flora throughout its extent (2) : such a zone dominated by a particular life form c : a distinctive belt, layer, or series of layers of earth materials (as rock)

[noun]:a region or area set off as distinct from surrounding or adjoining parts

[noun]:one of the sections of an area or territory created for a particular purpose: as a : a zoned section of a city b (1) : any of the eight concentric bands of territory centered on a given postal shipment point designated as a distance bracket for U.S. parcel post to which mail is charged at a single rate (2) : a distance within which the same fare is charged by a common carrier c : an area on a field of play d : a stretch of roadway or a space in which certain traffic regulations are in force

[noun]:ZONE DEFENSE

[noun]:a temporary state of heightened concentration experienced by a performing athlete that enables peak performance

[adjective]:ZONAL

[adjective]:of, relating to, or occurring in a zone defense

part 

英文：

[verb]:a : to separate from or take leave of someone b : to take leave of one another

[verb]:to become separated into parts

[verb]:a : to go away : DEPART b : DIE

[verb]:to become separated, detached, or broken

[verb]:to relinquish possession or control

[verb]:a : to divide into parts b : to separate by combing on each side of a line c : to break or suffer the breaking of (as a rope or anchor chain)

[verb]:to divide into shares and distribute : APPORTION

[verb]:a : to remove from contact or association b : to keep separate c : to hold (as brawlers) apart d : to separate by a process of extraction, elimination, or secretion

[noun]:a (1) : one of the often indefinite or unequal subdivisions into which something is or is regarded as divided and which together constitute the whole (2) : an essential portion or integral element b : one of several or many equal units of which something is composed or into which it is divisible : an amount equal to another amount c (1) : an exact divisor of a quantity : ALIQUOT (2) : PARTIAL FRACTION d : one of the constituent elements of a plant or animal body: as (1) : ORGAN, MEMBER (2) plural : PRIVATE PARTS e : a division of a literary work f (1) : a vocal or instrumental line or melody in concerted music or in harmony (2) : a particular voice or instrument in concerted music also : the score for it g : a constituent member of a machine or other apparatus also : a spare part

[noun]:something falling to one in a division or apportionment : SHARE

[noun]:one's share or allotted task (as in an action) : DUTY      

[noun]:a general area of indefinite boundaries---usually used in plural

[noun]:a function or course of action performed

[noun]:a : an actor's lines in a play b : the role of a character in a play

[noun]:a constituent of character or capacity : TALENT         

[noun]:the line where the hair is parted

[adverb]:PARTLY

[adjective]:PARTIAL

quarter

英文：

[verb]:a : to cut or divide into four equal or nearly equal parts b archaic : DIVIDE

[verb]:to provide with lodging or shelter

[verb]:to crisscross (an area) in many directions

[verb]:a : to arrange or bear (as different coats of arms) quarterly on one escutcheon b : to add (a coat of arms) to others on one escutcheon c : to divide (a shield) into distinct sections (as by stripes)

[verb]:LODGE, DWELL

[verb]:to crisscross a district

[verb]:to change from one quarter to another

[verb]:to strike on a ship's quarter

[noun]:one of four equal parts into which something is divisible : a fourth part

[noun]:any of various units of capacity or weight equal to or derived from one fourth of some larger unit                     

[noun]:any of various units of length or area equal to one fourth of some larger unit

[noun]:the fourth part of a measure of time: as a : one of a set of four 3-month divisions of a year b : a school term of about 12 weeks c : QUARTER HOUR

[noun]:a : a coin worth a quarter of a dollar b : the sum of 25 cents

[noun]:a : one limb of a quadruped with the adjacent parts especially : one fourth part of the carcass of a slaughtered animal including a leg b plural British : HINDQUARTER

[noun]:a : the region or direction lying under any of the four divisions of the horizon b : one of the four parts into which the horizon is divided or the cardinal point corresponding to it c : a compass point or direction other than the cardinal points d (1) : an unspecified person or group (2) : a point, direction, or place not definitely identified

[noun]:a : a division or district of a town or city b : the inhabitants of such a quarter

[noun]:a : an assigned station or post b plural : an assembly of a ship's company for ceremony, drill, or emergency c plural : living accommodations : LODGINGS

[noun]:merciful consideration of an opponent specifically : the clemency of not killing a defeated enemy

[noun]:a fourth part of the moon's period

[noun]:the side of a horse's hoof between the toe and the heel---see HOOF illustration

[noun]:a : any of the four parts into which a heraldic field is divided b : a bearing or charge occupying the first fourth part of a heraldic field

[noun]:the stern area of a ship's side

[noun]:one side of the upper of a shoe or boot from heel to vamp

[noun]:one of the four equal periods into which the playing time of some games is divided

[adjective]:consisting of or equal to a quarter

section

英文：

[verb]:to cut or separate into sections

[verb]:to represent in sections

[verb]:to become cut or separated into parts

[noun]:a : the action or an instance of cutting or separating by cutting b : a part set off by or as if by cutting

[noun]:a distinct part or portion of something written (as a chapter, law, or newspaper)

[noun]:a : the profile of something as it would appear if cut through by an intersecting plane b : the plane figure resulting from the cutting of a solid by a plane

[noun]:a natural subdivision of a taxonomic group

[noun]:a character § used as a mark for the beginning of a section and as a reference mark

[noun]:a piece of land one square mile in area forming especially one of the 36 subdivisions of a township

[noun]: a distinct part of a territorial or political area, community, or group of people

[noun]:a : a part that may be, is, or is viewed as separated b : one segment of a fruit : CARPEL

[noun]:a basic military unit usually having a special function

[noun]:a very thin slice (as of tissue) suitable for microscopic examination

[noun]:a : one of the classes formed by dividing the students taking a course b : one of the discussion groups into which a conference or organization is divided

[noun]:a : a part of a permanent railroad way under the care of a particular crew b : one of two or more vehicles or trains which run on the same schedule

[noun]:one of several component parts that may be assembled or reassembled

[noun]:a division of an orchestra composed of one class of instruments

[noun]:SIGNATURE

 

注释：

 

急速上升，猛增

zoom

英文：

[verb]:a : to move with a loud low hum or buzz b : to go speedily : ZIP

[verb]:of an airplane : to climb for a short time at an angle greater than that which can be maintained in steady flight so that the machine is carried upward at the expense of stored kinetic energy

[verb]:a : to focus a camera or microscope on an object using a zoom lens so that the object's apparent distance from the observer changes---often used with in or out b : FOCUS, ZERO---used with in

[verb]:to increase sharply

[verb]:to cause to zoom

[noun]:a : an act or process of zooming especially : a sharp upward movement b : an image created by zooming

[noun]:a zooming sound

[noun]:a means of producing an enlarged image (as in a camera) specifically : ZOOM LENS

whiz

英文：

[verb]:to hum, whir, or hiss like a speeding object (as an arrow or ball) passing through air

[verb]:to fly or move swiftly especially with a whiz

[verb]:to cause to whiz especially : to rotate very rapidly

[noun]:a hissing, buzzing, or whirring sound

[noun]:a movement or passage of something accompanied by a whizzing sound

[noun]:sometimes vulgar : an act of urinating---used especially in the phrase take a whiz

[noun]:WIZARD

speed

英文：

[verb]:a : to make haste <sped to her bedside> b : to go or drive at excessive or illegal speed

[verb]:to move, work, or take place faster : ACCELERATE

[verb]:a : to cause to move quickly : HASTEN b : to wish Godspeed to c : to increase the speed of : ACCELERATE

[verb]:to send out

[noun]:a : the act or state of moving swiftly : SWIFTNESS b : rate of motion: as (1) : VELOCITY (2) : the magnitude of a velocity irrespective of direction c : IMPETUS

[noun]:swiftness or rate of performance or action : VELOCITY       

[noun]:a : the sensitivity of a photographic film, plate, or paper expressed numerically b : the light-gathering power of a lens or optical system c : the time during which a camera shutter is open

[noun]:a transmission gear in automotive vehicles or bicycles---usually used in combination  

[noun]:someone or something that appeals to one's taste

[noun]:METHAMPHETAMINE also : a related stimulant drug and especially an amphetamine

zip

英文：

[verb]:to move, act, or function with speed and vigor

[verb]:to travel with a sharp hissing or humming sound

[verb]:to impart speed or force to

[verb]:to add zest, interest, or life to---often used with up

[verb]:to transport or propel with speed

[noun]:a sudden sharp hissing or sibilant sound

[noun]:ENERGY, VIM

注释：
